title: How beneficial is it to read academic journals? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re an academic in the field, it’s essential to “keeping up” with current scholarship. If you’re an academic not in the field, it might be helpful if the scholarship is relevant to your field. If you’re an inquiring lay person, you may derive some benefit from a given scholarly article, but likely you will lack the context to fully and properly understand it. “A little learning is a dangerous thing.”

Short answer - it depends. Reading academic journals is certainly not my recommendation for pleasure reading, but if you need source material for an essay that you are writing, then you can not find better material to back up your argument. Academic journals are peer reviewed, meaning they’ve been scrutinized by scholars in that field. As such, you won’t find more credible sources. Hope this has helped answer your question.
